title: Emerging Market Bonds May Take a Breather Before Next Rally
text:
Where in the world can you get a decent interest rate on government bonds? Most places, actually, that aren’t the U.S., Europe or Japan.

Investors in emerging market sovereigns have been richly rewarded this year, even relative to other sectors of a surging fixed-income market. Yields, which run inversely to prices, have plunged faster than U.S. Treasury debt, tightening the average spread on dollar-denominated emerging market bonds by 90 basis points, or 0.9%, says Eric Baurmeister, head of emerging markets debt at Morgan...
description: Emerging market specialists are hunting off the beaten track in places like Nigeria and Egypt to keep the outsized returns rolling.
